entry.title: Sony A7r V :: Hands on First Look

media:group.media:title: Sony A7r V :: Hands on First Look
media:group.media:description:
My NEW film simulation presets are 40% off! https://tedforbes.sellfy.store/
I've been shooting with the new Sony A7r V for the last week - this is a very interesting camera with one of the most advanced autofocus systems of any mirrorless to date. Cameras like the Canon R5 and Nikon Z9 have had expanded subject detection for a while, but Sony has now incorporated a dedicated processor. This processor acts as a neural engine for autofocus and subject recognition using AI.
00:00 61 MP Sensor, BIONZ XR Processor and Neural Engine 00:31 Body and Handling 00:53 New Rear Screen 01:15 Video Features 01:59 Improvements over the Sony A7r IV 02:53 AI Autofocus Explained 03:15 Human Pose Estimation 04:15 Sensitivity and ISO Performance 04:58 Automatic White Balance Improvements 05:18 Image Quality 05:59 Is it worth upgrading from the A7r IV? 07:05 EVF performance 07:33 In Body Image Stabilization IBIS 09:08 Complaint - Feature Creep in the Menu Design 10:12 Complaint the new "Main Menu" 11:06 Complaint - Feature Inconsistency Between Cameras 12:25 Is the A7r V worth it? Final Thoughts

entry.title: Inside Apple Park iPhone Camera Secrets!

media:group.media:title: Inside Apple Park iPhone Camera Secrets!
media:group.media:description:
This year I was invited to the iPhone 14 keynote at the Steve Jobs Theater. Afterwards I had a rare opportunity to go inside Apple Park to test the new iPhone 14 Max Pro and talk to Francesca Sweet, Worldwide iPhone Product Line Marketing Manager and Jon McCormack, Vice President of Camera Software Engineering about the camera system, 48 megapixel sensor and the Photonic Engine in the new iPhone 14.
Check out Jon McCormack on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/jonmccormackphoto/
Special thanks to Apple for inviting me to come make this video!

entry.title: iPhone 14 Pro Max - The best camera system yet?

media:group.media:title: iPhone 14 Pro Max - The best camera system yet?
media:group.media:description:
Now - even deeper pixels. I’ve been using the iPhone 14, Pro and Pro Max models for the last week and I want to share my experience with you so far in this video.
00:00 Intro 01:21 iPhone 14 Models Pro and Pro Max 02:09 Build Quality 02:27 differences between models 03:00 Dynamic Island 03:53 Customizable Lock Screen and Always On Display 05:02 OLED displays and brightness 05:23 Emergency Features SOS and Crash Detection 05:37 iPhone 14 Cameras 06:49 Photonic Engine 07:39 Video and Action Mode 08:26 New 48 Megapixel Sensor 11:07 My thoughts on the new cameras
Watch more iPhone videos https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JlnfZ3NGRro&list=PLGEE7pGLuppRc3M5ncslcBqCR2yHScNqy&ab_channel=TheArtofPhotography
The new iPhone 14 models feature brand new camera systems and faster processors enabling much better imaging performance. The new Photonic Engine allows for Deep Fusion before the compression stage. This allows a higher level of image quality with efficient processing speeds.
With new emergency features, the new A16 processor, the new dynamic island and better battery life - is the iPhone 14 worth the upgrade? Depends on what your needs are but so far I’ve been very impressed with these phones.

entry.title: Hasselblad X2D Hands On Preview :: Medium Format Awesomeness

media:group.media:title: Hasselblad X2D Hands On Preview :: Medium Format Awesomeness
media:group.media:description:
My NEW film simulation presets are 40% off! https://theartofphotography.tv/presets/
00:00 What’s New in the X2D 04:01 The new 100 Megapixel Sensor 04:37 High ISO and Low Light Performance 06:58 Dynamic Range and Color Range 07:50 Body and Handling 08:30 Top Display 09:20 New Rear Dial Press Function 09:40 Flash Sync 09:59 USB-C Power Delivery 10:11 Remote Triggering 10:47 EVF and Rear Screen 11:55 Autofocus Performance 13:42 Video 14:09 Battery Performance 14:52 New V Lenses 16:42 Alternatives to the X2D 19:14 Impressions
I’ve been shooting the new Hasselblad X2D for a few weeks now and I’m really excited to share my initial impressions in this video. Hasselblad has finally announced the new X2D as well as three “V series” lenses - a 38mm f/2.5, 55mm f/2.5 and a 90mm f/2.5 - all are considerably lighter and much quieter than the first generation lenses.
The X2D features a new 100MP, BSI sensor with phase detection autofocus. There is a new top level screen, high resolution EVF, tiltable rear touch screen, in-body image stabilization, a built in 1TB SSD drive and other new features discussed in this video.

entry.title: What I really love about the Canon R7 :: Full Review

media:group.media:title: What I really love about the Canon R7 :: Full Review
media:group.media:description:
My NEW film simulation presets are 40% off! https://theartofphotography.tv/presets/
I've been shooting on the Canon EOS R7 for about a month. I think its probably my favorite option for an APS-C camera on the market right now. Canon have really done a nice job on this. The Sony a6600 and Fujifilm X-T4 are really nice options as well, but I think when you factor in the features vs price point - the R7 is tough to beat. This is my full review with image and video samples.
0:00 What's new in the Canon EOS R7? 0:58 Canon R7 Features 1:45 How good are Canon Mirrorless Cameras? 2:37 Canon R7 Sensor 3:10 Autofocus - maybe the best Canon has produced 3:56 High Speed Continuous Shooting 5:23 Image Quality on the R7 7:25 R7 Video Specs and Performance 8:43 Design and Handling 9:24 Best Lenses for the Canon R7 11:18 Rear Screen and EVF Resolution 11:34 Connections and Compatibility 11:47 Battery Life 12:03 Alternatives to the R7
